type2_incorrect.reasoning: Login page lacks explicit client-side email validation using the regex pattern. Only has HTML5 type='email' attribute, whereas spec requires client-side validation for email format and registration page implements explicit regex validation

Login page error handling displays error object instead of error message string. Line 32 sets error to data.error (an object {code, message}), but line 81 renders it as text, resulting in '[object Object]' display

Registration page error handling displays error object instead of error message string. Line 53 sets error to data.error (an object {code, message}), but line 115 renders it as text, resulting in '[object Object]' display
Dashboard displays mock user data ('User', 'user@example.com') instead of actual logged-in user's name. Line 42 hardcodes mock values instead of using user data from authentication response or API
Login route uses error code 'MISSING_CREDENTIALS' instead of specified 'MISSING_FIELDS' for required fields validation. Spec lists MISSING_FIELDS as the code for 'Required fields missing'
